question.text: When may you use hazard warning lights when driving?

explanation.text: When there’s queuing traffic ahead and you have to slow down or even stop, showing your hazard warning lights will alert following traffic to the hazard. Don’t forget to switch them off as the queue forms behind you.

answer.text: Instead of sounding the horn in a built-up area between 11.30 pm and 7 am
On a motorway or unrestricted dual carriageway, to warn of a hazard ahead
On rural routes, after a warning sign of animals
On the approach to toucan crossings where cyclists are waiting to cross
